title: Stop geth manually timeout
body:
Hi and sorry my english
#### System information

Geth version:  1.13.2-stable-dc34fe82
CL client & version: Latest Prysm version is v4.0.8.

DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu
DISTRIB_RELEASE=20.04
DISTRIB_CODENAME=focal
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Ubuntu 20.04.6 LTS"

Hardware:

NVME 4TB crucial, i5 6500T and 32 gb ram.

After about 15 days I had to restart my server and in order not to force a shutdown and keep the database correct, I thought I had stopped the services correctly, until when I started up I lost 30 attestations.

Checking the logs I see that he couldn't stop in 120 seconds and he was killed by force, do you know what the reason could be? 

Logs

Another question, is it normal to have a connection to an IP and port 30304? netstat -putona | group: 30304
tcp 0 0 192.168.2.202:44536 213.165.185.219:30304 ESTABLISHED 2724/geth keepalive (3.37/0/0)
?

Regarding the timeout, the last interesting log in your dump was: 

```
oct 02 11:55:34 nodoeth geth[1200468]: INFO [10-02|11:55:34.000] Writing cached state to disk             block=18,262,085 hash=724450..1aa280 root=f33036..0b8d64
```

This never finished. Seems it just needed a bit more time. That's also the reason why on startup it logged

```
oct 02 11:59:10 nodoeth geth[2724]: WARN [10-02|11:59:10.943] Head state missing, repairing            number=18,262,085 hash=724450..1aa280 snaproot=c39da7..ba6d93
```

The short term solution is to raise the shutdown time allowance.

That said, Geth v1.13 introduced path based storage scheme, which doesn't require this long shutdown time any more and even in case of a crash will start back up a lot faster. So depending on whether you want to switch to path mode or not:

- Stick with the current hash scheme and raise the shutdown timeout a bit. Say to 5 minutes.
- Switch to path scheme, but you'd need to resync since we can't upgrade the database. You should use the master branch for this if you do, it has a Pebble fix that's not yer released.

---

Wrt the 30304 port, that's fine. By default Geth opens port 30303, but there's nothing stopping someone from running their instance on a different port (e.g. they could be running more that one execution client behind the same IP so they have multiple different ports open).
Closing as "working as intended", but feel free to comment if you feel otherwise.
